simulator.framework
Class MessageInjector

java.lang.Object
  simulator.payloads.Networkable
      simulator.framework.MessageInjector
All Implemented Interfaces:
Parser, TimeSensitive
public class MessageInjector
extends Networkable
implements TimeSensitive, Parser

This class is responsible for parsing mf files and creating the objects that do the actual message injections and assertion monitoring. Objects are constructed according to the text format described in the command line documentation in Elevator. It is important that any changes to this class also result in changes to the documentation in Elevator.printFullUsage().

parse

public void parse(java.lang.String[] words,
                  FileTokenizer sourceFT)
           throws java.text.ParseException
Contructs one of the helper objects classes (InjectablePayload, MessageAssertionMonitor,StateAssertionMonitor) based on the contents of the line, then queues it for execution.

Specified by:
parse in interface Parser
Parameters:
words - The current line from the file being parsed with comments removed and split into tokens by whitespace.
sourceFT - The FileTokenizer that created the line.
Throws:
java.text.ParseException - Thrown if the syntax of the line is not valid in the context of the parser.

timerExpired

public void timerExpired(java.lang.Object msg)
callback for scheduled helper objects.

Specified by:
timerExpired in interface TimeSensitive
Parameters:
msg - The helper object to be executed. This object must implement Executable.
